Package dataAccess

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataAccess.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This is the main interface to the SQLite database. This layer of abstraction allows accessors to modify/query the database without worrying (as much as possible) about directly handling JDBC data types

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  Database.LoadCallback
      The functional interface for callbacks passed to the Database.load function
      static interface  Database.QueryCallback<ModelType>
      The functional interface for callbacks passed to the Database.query function

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.sql.Connection connection
      The current connection object for the database
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.sql.PreparedStatement> openStatements
      A list of PreparedStatements that need to be closed
      private static boolean shouldUseTestDB
      Indicates if the testing database should be used or not

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Database()
      Creates a database with no connection at first.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database()
        Creates a database with no connection at first. The connection will be checked/generated when any of the Database methods are called.

    • Method Detail

      • useTestDB

        public static void useTestDB()

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws DatabaseException
        A method called by the garbage collector; This is just a checker to help ensure that connections are closed properly
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when an active connection still exists

      • close

        public void close()
           throws DatabaseException
        A deconstructor that destroys the active connection (if one was ever created)
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if the connection throws a SQLException in rollback() or close()

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws DatabaseException
        Clears and resets all tables in the database, rolling back any current changes
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • load

        public void load​(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
          throws DatabaseException
        Loads arbitrary data into the database, ignoring all safety checks and rolling back all current changes
        Parameters:
        statement - is the prepared statement to execute
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • load

        public void load​(Database.LoadCallback callback)
          throws DatabaseException
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • getActiveConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getActiveConnection()
        Returns the currently active connection, if any
        Returns:
        the connection, if one is present, or null

      • prepareStatement

        public java.sql.PreparedStatement prepareStatement​(java.lang.String sqlToExec)
                                            throws DatabaseException
        Creates a new prepared statement from the database. If a connection to the database doesn't exist, this method will create one
        Parameters:
        sqlToExec - is a string containing SQL code to load into the statement
        Returns:
        the loaded statement
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • query

        public <ModelType> java.util.ArrayList<ModelType> query​(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement,
                                                        Database.QueryCallback<ModelType> resultMapper)
                                                 throws DatabaseException
        Executes the statement as a query call to the database
        Type Parameters:
        ModelType - is the model type expected from the query
        Parameters:
        statement - is the prepared statement to execute
        resultMapper - is a callback that takes a statement result and turns it into a model instance
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of models that matched the query
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • query

        public <ModelType> java.util.ArrayList<ModelType> query​(java.lang.String statement,
                                                        Database.QueryCallback<ModelType> resultMapper)
                                                 throws DatabaseException
        Executes the statement as a query call to the database
        Type Parameters:
        ModelType - is the model type expected from the query
        Parameters:
        statement - is the prepared statement to execute
        resultMapper - is a callback that takes a statement result and turns it into a model instance
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of models that matched the query
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

        public int update​(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
           throws DatabaseException
        Executes the statement as an insert/update/delete call to the database
        Parameters:
        statement - is the prepared statement to executs
        Returns:
        the number of modified rows
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • execute

        public boolean execute​(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
                throws DatabaseException
        Executes the statement in its current state
        Parameters:
        statement - is the prepared statement to execute
        Returns:
        the value obtained by statement.execute(); "true if the first result is a ResultSet object; false if the first result is an update count or there is no result"
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • execute

        public boolean execute​(java.lang.String statement)
                throws DatabaseException
        Executes the statement in its current state
        Parameters:
        statement - is the prepared statement to execute
        Returns:
        the value obtained by statement.execute(); "true if the first result is a ResultSet object; false if the first result is an update count or there is no result"
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws DatabaseException
        Commits executed statements to the database
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws DatabaseException
        Clears the effects of executed statements to the last commit (or the start of the connection)
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - when a SQLException occurs

      • initializeConnectionIfNoneExists

        private void initializeConnectionIfNoneExists()
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new connection object and stores it as this.connection. Creating the connection lazily (as opposed to in the constructor) avoids throwing SQLExceptions when constructing.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the DriverManager cannot create a connection

      • createConnection

        private java.sql.Connection createConnection​(boolean enforceForeignKeys)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        The generic algorithm for creating a connection for FamilyMap
        Parameters:
        enforceForeignKeys - indicates if foreign keys should be respected
        Returns:
        the new connection (don't forget to close it!)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the DriverManager cannot create a connection
